page.title: 06HIGHBRIDGE STATION
page.content: THE STATION AT HIGHBRIDGE IS NOW A PITIFULL SITE.THE OLD BUILDINGS,SAID TO HAVE BEEN DESIGNED BY I.K BRUNEL WERE RECENTLY DEMOLISHED,DESPITE LOCAL OPPOSITION.THESE OLD LIMESTONE BUILDINGS HAVE BEEN REPLACED BY TWO BRICK BOX LIKE STRUCTURES WHICH RESEMBLE BUS SHELTERS. DESPITE THIS,WESTERN REGION SERVICES BETWEEN BRISTOL AND TAUNTON STILL HAVE STOPPING TRAINS AND,AT PRESENT,SERVICES ARE WELL SUPPORTED. IN ITS HEYDAY THE STATION WAS A FUNCTION FOR THE G.W.R AND THE SOMERSET AND DORSET RAILWAY.THERE WERE TWO STATIONS,ENGINE WORKSHOPS,WAGON REPAIR SHOPS WITH ROUTES TO DORSET AND VIA STEAMERS TO SOUTH WALES. NOW THE TRAFFIC WHICH USED TO FLOW THROUGH THE STATION,FLOWS ALONG THE NEARBY M5.
